qas.question: What is Nigeria's 2015 purchasing power parity?
When did Nigeria's economy become larger than South Africa's?
What is the largest economy in Africa?

context: As of 2015[update], <a3_0>Nigeria<a3_0/> is the world's 20th largest economy, worth more than <a0_0>$500 billion<a0_0/> and <a1_0>$1 trillion<a1_0/> in terms of nominal GDP and purchasing power parity respectively. It overtook South Africa to become Africa's largest economy in <a2_0>2014<a2_0/>. Also, the debt-to-GDP ratio is only <a4_0>11 percent<a4_0/>, which is 8 percent below the 2012 ratio. Nigeria is considered to be an emerging market by the World Bank; It has been identified as a regional power on the African continent, a middle power in international affairs, and has also been identified as an emerging global power. Nigeria is a member of the MINT group of countries, which are widely seen as the globe's next "BRIC-like" economies. It is also listed among the "Next Eleven" economies set to become among the biggest in the world. Nigeria is a founding member of the Commonwealth of Nations, the African Union, OPEC, and the United Nations amongst other international organisations.
